content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– A cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– A dedicated factory burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5); its neighbors include another burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)
– An assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at (1.5, 19.5)
– A lab (electrical_id: 7106) that participates in the complex (position not specified)

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
– An adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
– A dedicated depot burner inserter at (3.5, 14.5) positioned next to the depot chest

### Extraction System at (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– An extraction system burner inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (–3.5, 28.5)
– (This interface feeds items from the extraction side into the belt network)

### Electricity Generator at (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)
– A boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– An offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
– (These entities form the power generation system supplying energy to nearby structures)

### Smelting Facility at (approximately –3.5, 20.0)
Consists of:
– A stone furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) producing iron plates
– A stone furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) producing copper plates
– Wooden chests at (–4.5, 18.5) and (–5.5, 21.5) that serve as material depots for smelting outputs

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
– When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Ensure to add an inserter to input items into the target entity before attempting a belt connection.
– When placing entities (e.g. wooden chests), verify that the target position is within the allowed placement range. Move closer if the target is too far and confirm the entity exists in the inventory.
– A NameError (as with the undefined “target_chest”) indicates that all variables must be correctly defined and referenced. Double‐check naming conventions and available variable names before use.
– Inventory shortages (such as “No wooden_chest in inventory”) require confirming sufficient stock prior to placement actions to avoid resource–related errors.
